授業目的: The purpose of this course is for students to understand the history and principles of Canadian economy and its interaction with the economy of Japan. The course will cover topics on Canadian economy, its historical and cultural aspects, interaction and comparison with the economy of Japan. The course does NOT require previous knowledge of economics, mathematics, finance, or business science. The course will primarily involve lecture style format, but participation and discussion among the students is welcome and encouraged.
到達目標:
·         Students will learn how Canadian economy developed over time, how it compares with other modern economies (including Japan), and how it interacts with the other economies.

·         Students will be familiarized with the differences and similarities between the North American (Canada) and East Asian (Japan) financial markets and institutions.

·         Students will be able to discuss the cultural nuances of doing business in Canada compared to Japan.
授業方法: The course is designed as an in-person engagement, combining traditional lectures with a range of in-class activities to enhance learning. Throughout the term, LUNA will serve as the central hub for disseminating homework assignments, handouts, and critical dates for exams and project submissions. Active participation is expected from students in discussions, case studies, and various group activities that form an integral part of the class sessions. This participatory approach is aimed at deepening understanding and fostering a collaborative learning environment.
